meanings.def: to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this
examples: Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.
The bag split, and sugar spilled everywhere.
(figurative) Light spilled from the windows.
(figurative) He opened the curtains, letting the morning light spill into the room.
spill something He startled her and made her spill her drink.
Thousands of gallons of crude oil were spilled into the ocean.
I managed to carry three full glasses without spilling a drop.
I accidentally spilled my drink all over him.

meanings.def: to come out of a place in large numbers and spread out
examples: The doors opened and people spilled into the street.
After the clubs closed, the drinkers spilled out into the streets.

meanings.def: to waste time worrying about something that has happened that you cannot do anything about
examples: As the saying goes—it's no use crying over spilt milk.

meanings.def: to tell somebody something that should be kept secret or private

examples: Nothing can justify spilling innocent blood.

meanings.def: to tell somebody everything you know or feel about something, because you are upset
examples: He has spilled his guts in his new autobiography.

meanings.def: an act of letting a liquid come or fall out of a container; the amount of liquid that comes or falls out
examples: Many seabirds died as a result of the oil spill.
I wiped up the coffee spills on the table.

meanings.def: a long match, or a thin piece of twisted paper, used for lighting fires, oil lamps, etc.
a fall, especially from a bicycle or a boat
examples: to take a spill

meanings.def: the excitement that is involved in dangerous activities, especially sports
examples: Experience the thrills and spills of surfing!
